data.title: Best lunch place in town
data.text: I've been eating lunch on the run at 8th street coffee house for a couple of years. They treat you like family. I usually call my order in ahead due to I have a very tight schedule at work. The last time I ordered lunch I again called ahead, when I received my usual order of a BLT and strawberry-banana smoothly with milk- I noticed on my smoothie lid there was a note which read, "Have awesome day Marnie." It was nice to receive the nice words which brightened my day. Another time when I made the call ahead, when I arrived there was a long line; I had an employee call to me from the back of the line asking me to come to the front of the line stating my order was waiting- they let me come to the front of the line to pay so my food would not get cold. They have awesome fresh smoothies which are the best in town. And their fresh sandwiches are awesome. If you are looking for a comfortable place to have a quick lunch- this is the place for you. I believe they are also open for breakfast . This place reminds me of the coffee shop on the television series "Friends."  They have a good selection of board games to hang out with friends/co-workers- you just have to ask for them. I believe they have an open mic night once per week. The only downfall to this place is they close too early. They are only open one night per week past 4:00 pm. They had late hours on the weekend, but have changed to one night per week. They have a great selection of fresh sandwiches, fresh smoothies and coffees. I encourage everyone to try this place at least once- you will come back often. Thank you 8th Street Coffee House!!! You are the best lunch place with all fresh food- if you give them a try-you will be a customer for life, as I am.

data.title: Hip place and fab food
data.text: This place boasts all kinds of character, with a fabulous drink and food menu. Reasonable pricing too. I was visiting Wichita Falls, but if I lived there I would definitely be a frequent patron, just take a book and have coffee and dessert and chill. The bathrooms are upstairs, only downside I can think of if stairs are an issue.

data.title: Great spot for a quiet interview
data.text: I met a colleague for an interview and it was a perfect setting. We had a quiet place, the staff was respectful in not interrupting. The food and coffee drinks were as good as always. Well done!!

data.title: Fun, kitschy coffeehouse in WF
data.text: Stopped for breakfast during recent road trip. Good food, eclectic environment and relaxed atmosphere. Not exactly what I would expect to find in downtown WF- a pleasant surprise. Note that the mapping nay be a block off- we almost missed it, since street view picture was a vacant storefront. Stay a while and enjoy.

data.title: Good sandwich and atmosphere
data.text: Stopped in for lunch with friends and was pleasantly surprised.  Potato salad was very good and club sandwich was very good.  I had an Italian soda but needed a double shot (at least) of flavor.  will order it that way next time.  would like to see a broader soup menu but it is summertime.

data.title: Soso
data.text: I thought,  being a downtown coffee shop,  you could get a cup and a refill would come with it.  Ordered breakfast,  not a lot for the price.  Place is unique,  but better breakfast spots in Wichita Falls.

data.title: Best coffee spot in WF
data.text: This place is great, in a lost lil town it's an oasis of good coffee and decent food.  Nice atmosphere, comfortable seating..

data.title: So Unique
data.text: My friend and I enjoyed a leisurely breakfast together in this delightful spot. The food was so good with the breakfast burrito among the top ever tasted. The veggie croissant was very good, too. The coffee, both the plain and latte were served in real cups and very good.

data.title: Lunch
data.text:
I love this place! It is so comfy and I love the different seatings and the different mugs!
Food is great and when It's not crazy busy, the service is great!
HOWEVER! I'm only giving it 3 because every.single.time. I have visited, I have to go home and wash all of the clothes I was wearing. There is s heavy food smell in there and it stinks to... every part of you and what you are wearing!
But of course Il'l be back.. But I never wear nice expensive clothes when I visit.

data.title: Surprising Gem in Wichita Falls
data.text: Traveling through Texas on my way to Denver, finding such an eclectic little coffee house was certainly the last thing I expected to find in Wichita Falls, but I wanted to cozy up with a book or my laptop and just stay for awhile. With unique decor and a surprisingly great breakfast sandwich, I lament I only had a few minutes to spare while passing through!

data.title: Delightful spot!
data.text: We stopped in after church on Sunday and we're delighted with all the food we ordered. The special of the day was biscuits, eggs and gravy and was so tasty. The Pecan Pie was delicious and a generous serving. The Breakfast Philly Melt was good, too. We will look forward to going back for some specialty coffee. Very friendly staff, too.

data.title: Cool coffee house
data.text: Very funky little place. Staff is super friendly and effecient. Cozy and fun Funiture. Great cup of coffee and great breakfast and pastries. Prices are reasonable.

data.title: LOVE this Coffee House!
data.text: Absolutely love this coffee house, right mixture of art, comfy furniture, tables, wifi, great desserts and excellent drink. I try to schedule my trip to or through WF so I can stop for one of their excellent coffee drinks. They offer a full menu of what I would consider dessert drinks...S'mores, Chocolate Cherry something, and the full menu goes on. Love it!

data.title: Just what you want.
data.text: Excellent food and drinks. A relaxed atmosphere several people were playing board games and just talking to each other. The coffee was perfect. I also enjoyed their sandwiches.

data.title: Very cool local, family-owned place
data.text: This is the type of coffee house that has board games on a shelf and an open mic night once a week.  The coffee is fantastic, and they will of course make it any way you want.  The people who work here are really friendly.

data.title: Comfortable and Delishous
data.text: Whether you just need a cup of joe or a more substantial treat this business is the place to go.  The staff is kind and patient while you try to choose from their varied and interesting menu.  There are tables with wooden chairs, couches, comfy chairs and a bar with stools to choose to park while you enjoy their wares.

data.title: Funky place
data.text: We chose this place in part because we had family business to conduct and this is a decent choice for long, leisurely lunches. I had a tasty club sandwich and good iced tea. Chicken salad sandwiches were also ordered and were pretty tasty as well. The décor is shabby, yet seemed clean enough. Nothing seemed to match or come from the same era, but it works okay I suppose. Nice staff and a steady stream of customers make this place even more interesting. Many parts of our country are so enamored with chain restaurants that a place like 8th street is a welcome departure from the redundancy of corporate American eateries.

data.title: Business breakfast
data.text: Had an early morning meeting and this was a central place for both of us to meet.  I got there early, got my coffee and settled in with WiFi to work while I waited.  My other party was late to the meeting, but I got a lot of work done and enjoyed the food and drink.

data.title: Funky cool place, nice lunch and good coffee
data.text:
While in Wichita Falls for a quilt shop hop we found this cafe/coffee house. The lunch combos are great - sandwich and soup or salad. Price is reasonable and food is good. It is hard to find a table because the place is well liked and nice to relax with lunch and conversation.
I was with a group of friends, each of us got a combo - none of them the same but everyone enjoyed. The meals also came with a Hershey's Kiss - a nice touch.

The iced tea was so good and the weekly drink special the Hazelnut Sl*t was a must.

The cafe is in an old building in downtown Wichita falls with lots of history.

If you are in town and want a fun experience this is the place to visit.

data.title: Best Place in Town
data.text: This is the best place in town to stop in for lunch. Atmosphere is relaxed and the staff is very friendly. Coffee is also a plus! If you find yourself in the downtown area make time for a sandwich!
